Pre-Game Insights: Michael O’Neill is looking to build on his side’s solid start to their latest UEFA Nations League campaign when they face Bulgaria.
O’Neill revealed the comfortable 2-0 win over Luxembourg had energized the team ahead of the game with Bulgaria.
Northern Ireland top the group at this early stage and O’Neill admitted he would like to cement that position ahead of another double header next month.
Despite Bulgaria’s poor showing in their Euro 2024 qualifying group, O’Neill is expecting a tough night in sweltering conditions in Plovdiv.
O’Neill has a very youthful squad at his disposal for the game in Plovdiv, while the Bulgarians have players with little international experience.
Bulgaria’s goalkeepers are particularly inexperienced, with Dimitar Mitov having only four senior appearances.
The most experienced player in Bulgaria’s squad is captain and striker Kiril Despodov, who has scored 14 goals in 50 appearances for his country.
Bulgaria will be without midfielder Filip Krastev for the game after he was sent off during last week’s draw in Zalaegerszeg.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bulgaria created 17 chances in the game against Belarus, compared to eight attempts for Belarus.
O’Neill is expecting Bulgaria to take the game to Northern Ireland as he tries to engineer what would only be Northern Ireland's third victory in 18 Nations League games.
